title: Quiz 2: Contact Diseases
description: Deep dive into infections transmitted through direct and indirect contact, including Scabies and Trachoma.

questions.question: What is the causative agent of Scabies?
questions.explanation: Scabies is caused by the female itch mite, Sarcoptes scabiei, which burrows into the skin.

questions.question: Arrange the steps for the correct application of 10% Benzyl Benzoate Emulsion (BBE) in scabies management:

items.text: Take a warm bath and scrub
Apply BBE all over the body
Bathe and put on clean clothes

questions.explanation: Proper management requires cleaning the skin first, applying the lotion, leaving it for a full day, and then repeating to kill newly hatched larvae.
questions.hint: Don't forget to repeat the treatment!

questions.question: Match the Ringworm (Tinea) type with the body part it affects:
questions.explanation: These Latin terms classify fungal infections by location: Capitis (head), Corporis (body), Pedis (foot), Unguium (nails).

questions.question: Which chronic eye inflammation, caused by Chlamydia trachomatis, is a major cause of blindness in water-scarce areas of East Africa?
questions.explanation: Trachoma is a leading cause of preventable blindness, spread by flies and lack of water for face washing.

questions.question: Trichiasis is the condition where the eyelids turn inwards and the eyelashes rub against the cornea.
questions.explanation: This is a late-stage complication of Trachoma that directly results in corneal damage and blindness.

questions.question: Which of the following are important risk factors for the spread of Candidiasis (Yeast infection)? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Candidiasis thrives in moist environments and in hosts with compromised immunity or altered flora.
questions.hint: Yeast loves sugar, moisture, and low competition.

questions.question: In Trachoma management, the surgical turning out of the inward-pointing eyelid is the treatment for ___BLANK___, while the drug of choice for early stages is ___BLANK___ topical eye ointment.
questions.explanation: Surgery corrects entropion; tetracycline ointment treats the Chlamydia infection.
questions.hint: One is a physical fix, one is a chemical fix.

questions.question: Review the clinical sign in the table. Which condition is it indicative of?

richContent.content:
LocationSymptom
Inside upper eyelidPinkish-grey lumps (Follicles)
Edge of corneaTiny blood vessels (Pannus)

questions.explanation: Follicles and Pannus formation are classic diagnostic signs for Trachoma.

questions.question: What is the primary reason for treating the whole family of a scabies patient even if they don't have symptoms?

options.text: To prevent re-infection from asymptomatic carriers

questions.explanation: Since scabies has an incubation period, family members may be infected without itching yet. Treating everyone breaks the transmission cycle.

questions.question: Which simple technology, using a container with a small hole, helps save water while promoting hand washing in dry areas?
questions.explanation: The 'leaky tin' technique minimizes water wastage in areas where scarcity contributes to diseases like Trachoma.
